title: Offensive Positions Explained
subtitle: Meet the Players Trying to Score
description: Learn about the key offensive positions and what each player does

What you'll learn: What the QB, RB, WR, TE, and OL do
Why certain positions handle the ball

sections.title: Meet the Offense
sections.content: The offense is the team with the ball trying to score. Let's meet the key players and understand what each position does.

sections.title: The Quarterback (QB)
sections.content: The quarterback is like the field general - they get the ball on every play and decide what to do with it.
details: Hands off the ball to running backs
Calls plays and audibles at the line

sections.title: Running Backs (RB)
sections.content: Running backs are the workhorses who carry the ball and catch passes out of the backfield.
details: Carry the ball on running plays
Catch short passes from the QB

sections.title: Wide Receivers (WR)
sections.content: These are the speed demons who run precise routes to catch passes downfield.

sections.title: Tight Ends (TE)
sections.content: Tight ends are versatile players who can both block like linemen and catch like receivers.

sections.title: Offensive Line (OL)
sections.content: The big guys up front who protect the quarterback and create holes for running backs.
details: Usually the biggest players on the team

sections.title: Working Together
sections.content: All 11 offensive players must work together on every play. Each position has a specific job, but they all depend on each other to move the ball and score points.
keyTakeaways: QB leads the offense and handles the ball
RB carries the ball and catches short passes
WR run routes and catch passes downfield
OL protects QB and blocks for RB

questions.question: Who touches the ball on every offensive play?
questions.explanation: The quarterback receives the snap on every play and decides whether to throw, hand off, or run.

questions.question: What is the main job of the offensive line?
questions.explanation: The offensive line's main job is to protect the quarterback and create holes for running backs.

questions.question: Which position is known for running precise pass routes?
questions.explanation: Wide receivers are known for running precise routes to get open and catch passes.

questions.question: Tight ends can both block and catch passes.
questions.explanation: Tight ends are versatile players who both block like linemen and catch passes like receivers.
